name: Morocco
description: Morocco, officially the Kingdom of Morocco, is a country located in North Africa. It borders Spain to the northwest, and lies along the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea to the west.  The country is characterized by diverse landscapes, ranging from the snow-capped Atlas Mountains to the vast Sahara Desert, and the fertile plains of the Souss Valley.  Morocco boasts a rich and complex history, influenced by Berber, Arab, European, and African cultures, reflected in its architecture, cuisine, and traditions. It's a popular tourist destination known for its vibrant cities, ancient medinas, stunning coastlines, and unique cultural experiences.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Morocco is diverse, with a significant Berber and Arab heritage.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly in Casablanca, Rabat, and Marrakech.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Rabat is the political and administrative center of Morocco.
quickFacts.detail: It's a modern city with a historic medina and numerous embassies.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Arabic is the official language of Morocco.
quickFacts.detail: Darija (Moroccan Arabic) is the most widely spoken dialect.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency of Morocco is the Moroccan Dirham.
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally, 1 USD is approximately 10-11 MAD.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Morocco covers a vast area of North Africa.
quickFacts.detail: It's the fourth largest country in Africa.

climateData.title: Moroccan Climate
climateData.description: Morocco experiences a Mediterranean climate in the north, transitioning to arid and semi-arid climates in the interior and desert regions.  The Atlas Mountains have a cooler, alpine climate. Rainfall is generally higher in the mountains and coastal areas.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are hot and dry, particularly in the interior and desert regions. Temperatures can soar above 40°C (104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings pleasant temperatures and less intense sunlight. Rainfall increases, especially in the mountains.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild in the coastal areas, but cold in the mountains. Snowfall is common in the Atlas Mountains and Rif Mountains.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is a beautiful time in Morocco, with blooming flowers and pleasant temperatures. Rainfall is moderate.

naturalWonders.name: Sahara Desert
naturalWonders.description: The Sahara Desert, the largest hot desert in the world, covers a significant portion of Morocco. It's a vast expanse of sand dunes, rocky plateaus, and oases, offering a unique and unforgettable experience.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Erg Chebbi dunes, near Merzouga, are particularly impressive, reaching heights of over 150 meters.  The Sahara is home to nomadic tribes who have adapted to the harsh environment for centuries.

naturalWonders.name: Atlas Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The Atlas Mountains are a rugged mountain range that runs through Morocco, offering stunning scenery, diverse ecosystems, and opportunities for adventure.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The highest peak, Toubkal, reaches 4,167 meters (13,671 feet). The mountains are home to Berber villages, waterfalls, and a variety of wildlife, including snow leopards and ibex.
viewingTips: Be prepared for changing weather conditions

naturalWonders.name: Todra Gorge
naturalWonders.description: The Todra Gorge is a spectacular canyon carved by the Todra River, known for its towering limestone cliffs and lush vegetation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The gorge is a popular destination for rock climbers and hikers. The walls of the canyon can reach heights of over 300 meters (984 feet).

biodiversityCategory.name: Saharan Wildlife
biodiversityCategory.description: The Sahara Desert supports a surprising array of wildlife adapted to the extreme conditions.

statistics.details: The Fennec Fox is the most iconic Saharan mammal.
Adapted to survive in the desert with specialized paws and fur.

notableSpecies.name: Fennec Fox
notableSpecies.significance: Highly adapted to the desert environment.

notableSpecies.name: Addax Antelope
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of desert conservation efforts.

ecosystemData.title: Moroccan Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Morocco’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from the arid Sahara Desert to the Mediterranean coast and the mountainous Atlas region. Each ecosystem supports unique flora and fauna, contributing to the country’s rich biodiversity.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 18% of Morocco's land area is protected in national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Morocco’s coastline is fringed with extensive wetlands, providing vital habitat for migratory birds and fish.

statistics.details: Important stopover site for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: Flamingo
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of the coastal wetlands.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Morocco
activities.description: Morocco offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience.

activityCategories.description: Explore the diverse landscapes of Morocco on foot.

activities.name: Atlas Mountains Trekking
activities.description: Trek through the stunning Atlas Mountains, visiting Berber villages and enjoying breathtaking views.

activities.name: Coastal Hiking
activities.description: Enjoy coastal trails along the Atlantic and Mediterranean coasts.
